attributes.action: Stop or reduce Tesco's expansion in the UK and unfair tactics used against it's rivals.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
'Tesco now controls 30% of the grocery market in the UK. In 2007, the supermarket chain announced over £2.5 billion in profits. Growing evidence indicates that Tesco's success is partly based on trading practices that are having serious consequences for suppliers, farmers and workers worldwide, local shops and the environment'

Tesco's creation of their 'express' stores mean that newsagents, small shops and small supermarkets are going out of business, they even told their employees in a national breifing that they will reduce the price of their electricals to take the electical product market share too. 

Until Tesco are stopped hundreds of businesses every month are going out of business.

Tesco is using unfair tactics in order to expand and consume more of the market, putting rivals out of business.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
